> OOC - This post is done on the assumption that the Ark is still on Earth,
> but mobile and thus outside of what will become known as Mt. St. Hillary in
> the names of the inhabitants, and that it is night out.

OOC: It is not mobile, but it is not yet quite burried completely and
so one can be sitting on top of it and looking at the stars. And it is
on Earth.

> <IC>
>
> IIT was much later, or perhaps much sooner, but Wheelie sat outside.
>
> Looking up at the heavens, or what they would be in several thousand years
> known.
>
> His astrography program trying to map them, where they were now in relation
> to the past, where his programs of the future would tell him what was, what
> would be.
>
> Glancing up at the planet at the time known as Quintessa, where even now he
> (or himself of the age) would be in hiding, fighting Sharkticons to stay
> alive, Wheelie just remembered.
>
> Thinking to that time however much later, he just sat back, glancing at hte
> heavens.  The small Mini-Car, Autobot Survivor, watched up.  The past was
> changing.  Gazing at the moon, the small circle of debris still perhaps
> surrounding the planet from the aborted Vok planetkiller..  Would the
> chnages they did here change his fate?  Would he still meet Rodimus andm be
> rescued?  Or had things already gone beyond that?

<NEW>

Times were changing, that was for sure. Whether they were changed
beyond fixing, it was difficult to know. If they had changed so far
would Wheelie still exist or would he simply pop and fall out of the
time stream discarded because his fate and movement along the time
line changed? Would it be the same for any of them?

The giant shape of TUSCON with RODIMUS on his back had passed by
several hours ago. So far the ones that were with WHEELIE, LEO PRIME,
SANTON, WING CALIBER still seemed to be going on as he knew them -
time itself still seemed to be moveing inexorably foward without
faltering, just as solid as the Ark he was sitting upon.

Could things have already changed? Could the things that WHEELIE
belived to be true, the things that seemed to be an indelible part of
his history be false - already having falling victim to the changes in
the time stream? Again hard to know.

Above WHEELIE bats took off on the nightly feeding from nearby caves,
floating on the hot breezes that blew off the sandy deserts that were
still far to their south. Hardy bushes and grasses swayed gentley to
and fro, struggling to grow in ground that had been scorched by
battles large and small that had been fought in and around the Ark.

What was it all for? Had they lost the battle already? Was this the
battle they were suppose to be fighting?

Who can say.

In the distance a night owl snagged one of the bats and flew higher
into the  air, its tastey meal still struggling in its claws.

(TAG)

Preston
